text: Medical image segmentation is a critical undertaking in computer vision, serving as a cornerstone in applications such as diagnostics, treatment planning, and medical research. This study investigates a broad spectrum of methodologies employed in medical research for achieving image segmentation. These methodologies encompass traditional approaches based on thresholding, edge detection, region-based techniques, and clustering, as well as contemporary artificial intelligence methods, particularly deep learning techniques. Each method's strengths and limitations are meticulously scrutinized. The primary focus of this paper is to assess various architectures utilized for medical image segmentation, with a specific emphasis on evaluating their performance. It endeavors to provide an in-depth analysis of different segmentation methods, offering a comparative viewpoint on their efficacy. Moreover, the document delves into the latest technological advancements in segmentation, highlighting significant breakthroughs capable of revolutionizing the precision and efficiency of medical image analysis. By compiling exhaustive data and critically evaluating the results obtained through the application of diverse segmentation strategies, the study presents a comprehensive overview of the outcomes, accompanied by a thorough analysis of the strengths and weaknesses inherent in the various techniques employed for medical image segmentation. This research contributes to an enhanced understanding of how these methods can be leveraged within the medical domain, particularly in the realm of computer vision.
